title: Lattice Assistant: QA Portal uses new line delimited json (chunked streaming) instead of regex parsing
body:
## [PD-89366](https://latticehr.atlassian.net/browse/PD-89366)

Opened a fresh PR after merge conflicts/rebase issues on prev branch: https://github.com/latticehr/lattice/pull/87693

## Why was this change made

<!--
Explain why you made this change. What context would help your reviewers understand what you did?
If this PR is one step in a larger set of work, how does this PR fit in the bigger picture?
-->

rather than string parsing and regex , this PR migrates the `/latticeAssistant` endpoint to send chunks of new-line delimited JSON. The frontend can then check the `type` of the chunk and handle it accordingly, whether that is appending the content to the answer which is being streamed, aggregating citations, or extracting trace id or question and answer entity id for tracking purposes

## What changed

Chunked Streaming replaces text stream with regex parsing

<!--
In a few sentences or bullet points, describe what this PR changed.
-->

## Validation

After most recent rebase (11/15): https://www.loom.com/share/ca741589595c41248ff3fffebda19f4c?sid=911a0d04-d5db-4317-8491-a9aeecdeda56


After rebase (11/14):

https://www.loom.com/share/55ae2965a4794c198d04446c63bc4246?sid=3ce78e79-c554-4655-b678-1f6e0798678d

https://github.com/latticehr/lattice/pull/87693


### Before deployment

<!--
How did you validate that this change works as expected, and is safe to merge?

Follow these guidelines to meet our quality bar:

1. All but the most trivial code should be unit tested. This is the only way to validate the lowest level code we run in production.

2. Anything that we expect people to run, like developer scripts, should be manually tested and proven they work as expected with screenshots.

3. Any change that impacts product functionality and FE pages should be manually tested, with a video demo (use `⌘` + `Shift` + `5` to record your screen). This includes BE changes that should reasonably be expected to impact FE experiences.
-->

### After deployment

<!--
Once your change is live, how will you verify that it's working as expected?

1. What metrics and logs will you check in DataDog?

2. For functional changes, how will you manually validate the feature? What production account will you test with?

You should also plan to add a comment to this PR describing the results after you’ve performed post-deployment verification.
-->

[PD-89366]: https://latticehr.atlassian.net/browse/PD-89366?atlOrigin=eyJpIjoiNWRkNTljNzYxNjVmNDY3MDlhMDU5Y2ZhYzA5YTRkZjUiLCJwIjoiZ2l0aHViLWNvbS1KU1cifQ

rather than string parsing and regex , this PR migrates the `/latticeAssistant` endpoint to send chunks of new-line delimited JSON. title: feat: updates lattice assistant output parsing
body:
## NO TICKET

## What changed

Instead of using XML tags and regEx to parse metadata, this PR uses JSON with /n delimiters to make frontend parsing more reliable. This was inspired by needing to add the questionAndAnswerEntityId to the latticeAssistantHandler for [this PR which updates tracking for the feedback ui](https://github.com/latticehr/lattice/pull/87049) and wanting to find a way for our lattice assistant data to adhere to llm streaming best practices in output parsing

Merge priority: 
1. Merge this PR^^
2. Rebase and merge this pr: https://github.com/latticehr/lattice/pull/87049

## Why was this change made

cleaning house so that we can add metadata to the json output for lattice assistant with more agility

## Validation

Updated test files

### Before deployment

<!--
How did you validate that this change works as expected, and is safe to merge?

Follow these guidelines to meet our quality bar:

1. All but the most trivial code should be unit tested. This is the only way to validate the lowest level code we run in production.

3. Anything that we expect people to run, like developer scripts, should be manually tested and proven they work as expected with screenshots.

4. Any change that impacts product functionality and FE pages should be manually tested, with a video demo (use `⌘` + `Shift` + `5` to record your screen). This includes BE changes that should reasonably be expected to impact FE experiences.
-->

### After deployment

<!--
Once your change is live, how will you verify that it's working as expected?

1. What metrics and logs will you check in DataDog?

2. For functional changes, how will you manually validate the feature? What production account will you test with?

You should also plan to add a comment to this PR describing the results after you’ve performed post-deployment verification.
-->

body: ## PD-89366 ## What changed QA Portal UI Polish pt 1. 1. Refactors files to simplify 2. Adds styling to header 3. Reflects change in layout (question size, remove user name) 4. Adds source count 5. Adds max-height 6. Background gradient 7. Empty state @carriejocasey could you link me to the design with the empty state (before a question is asked) See detailed notes here: https://www.notion.so/lattice/QA-Portal-UI-Polish-1307372d608580a3ab73e53c8d6771b4?pvs=4 Pt 2 (follow up PR): 1. Feedback UI states (disabled after feedback) Pt 3 (follow up PR) 1. Input arrow states (@carriejocasey mind linking me to these designs as well?)... Gradient on button in submit ## Why was this change made ## Validation ### Before deployment ### After deployment

title: Finesses feedback tracking in Lattice Assistant
body:
## PD-89364

## What changed

TODO: wait for https://github.com/latticehr/lattice/pull/87235/files to merge, then rebase so that I have access to the questionAnswerEntityId for tracking purposes (the foreign key that will allow @eve-lattice to join the feedback UI data to the question/answer pairs when querying our data warehouse)

- Removed unnecessary useMemo/useCallback
- Updated data sent to tracking fns

## Why was this change made

- For the time being, this data is being piped into segment. Ahead of the friendlies launch, however, we'll want to start storing this data in our DB and ensuring we have the ability to display it in the training center.

## Validation

### Before deployment

## What changed

1. Added mock data and mock relay architecture for the Interactive9Box 
2. Wrote basic smoke unit tests for Interactive9BoxView to safeguard against regressions as we continue developing

## Why was this change made

To prevent regressions in the course of the Reporting9Box epic

## Validation

Tests are passing!

title: fix: Reporting9Box shared component edge cases
body:
## PD-83581, PD-83582

## What changed

1. Fixed grid config so width of grid container correctly corresponds to x and y axis 
2. throw errors if num of scale labels is not the same as number of x or y scale
3. Error handling in Reporting9Box
4. Added test coverage 
5. Updated storybook example to include data with 2 axis of different length
6. Adds support for custom empty state component - @zoegreene please review logic and ensure it adheres with api
7. Adds support for single axis datasets

## Why was this change made

Some bugs and edge cases were revealed during implementation of this shared component. This PR addresses them. As a follow-up, an optional EmptyState component will be added to Reporting9Box as discussed with @zoegreene and @ThomasChang7 yesterday

## Validation

Test coverage, and storybook: 
![image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/d1174869-5897-472a-95c0-df072a94bb93)

Custom empty state: 
![image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/fd19d44a-3e39-40b6-b8e8-133f0b82dcea)

Default empty state: 
![image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/7509b6e9-e718-4898-bd41-09eeec3a8efc)

Single axis dataset: 
![image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/506ab036-b836-4b88-b7dc-d3e4cb18f7c5)
